page.title: 02INFORMATION SYSTEMS
page.content: Whittington house opened in 1983, is the purpose built headquarters of the Operations Division of British Telecom National Networks. It is a new 3 storey redbrick office block situated alongside the A483 Trunk Road on an area formerly occupied by a large army camp. They are now setting up an automatic {FREEFONE}service. This service, completely new to {Great {Britain,}is already used in{America,} and it will enable businesses to advertise {"TOLL FREE"}telephone numbers for the use of their customers. Oswestry has been the headquarters of Operations Division since British Telecom's privatisation in{1984. { }They are responsible for long distance communications, for planning the utilisation of cables and radio systems.
